item.title: Building networks with FreeBSD (Part 2)
item.description: Welcome to the second part of my tutorial series. In this post we’ll see how to use the Quagga Software Suite for dynamic routing. The dynamic routing protocols we ’ll use are the most widely used today: RIP, OSPF and BGP. For some details on what these protocols are used for, and how they work, you can take a look at this post. At the end of the post you will find details for the IPv6 versions of these protocols.

item.title: Building networks with FreeBSD (Part 1)
item.description: Welcome to my tutorial series for using the FreeBSD OS and the Quagga software routing suite for building network architectures. I hope this series serves a good reference point for anyone interested in examining and getting hands-on experience with the routing protocols and network topologies. However I won’t be going into the details on how the protocols work. To emulate the needed hardware for testing purposes, I ’m using VirtualBox, and I recommend it.
